title: Ethical Governance & Transparency
summary: Our commitment to transparent, ethical, and accountable AI development through comprehensive governance systems.
intro: QuantumPoly operates under a comprehensive ethical governance framework designed to ensure transparency, accountability, and responsible AI development. This page provides an overview of our governance systems and how we maintain ethical integrity.

eii.heading: Ethical Integrity Index (EII)
eii.description: The Ethical Integrity Index is our composite metric for measuring and tracking the ethical maturity of our systems. It aggregates technical compliance metrics across four key dimensions:

dimensions.seo: SEO & Discoverability — Ensuring our ethical commitments are publicly visible
dimensions.accessibility: Accessibility — WCAG 2.2 AA compliance for inclusive design
dimensions.performance: Performance — Efficient, sustainable systems that respect user resources
dimensions.bundle: Bundle Efficiency — Optimized code delivery for reduced environmental impact

ledger.heading: Transparency Ledger
ledger.description: Our transparency ledger is an immutable, cryptographically-verified record of all governance activities, compliance milestones, and ethical audits. Each entry is:

features.hashed: SHA256 hashed for data integrity verification
features.merkle: Merkle tree verified for tamper detection
features.signed: GPG signed for authenticity (implementation in progress)

framework.heading: Compliance Framework
framework.description: Our governance system aligns with international standards and regulations:

standards.gdpr: GDPR (EU General Data Protection Regulation) — Privacy by design
standards.dsg: Swiss DSG 2023 — Swiss data protection compliance
standards.aiact: EU AI Act 2024 — Transparency and accountability for AI systems
standards.ieee: IEEE 7000 — Value-based engineering for ethical systems

principles.heading: Governance Principles
principles.intro: Our governance framework is built on the following core principles:

items.transparency: Transparency — All governance activities are publicly documented
items.accountability: Accountability — Clear ownership and responsibility for ethical decisions
items.verifiability: Verifiability — Cryptographic proof of all compliance claims
items.inclusivity: Inclusivity — Accessible to all stakeholders, including people with disabilities
items.continuous: Continuous Improvement — Regular audits and iterative refinement
items.feedback: Stakeholder Feedback — Open channels for ethical concerns and suggestions
